intro: Cyanea kahiliensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, thriving in sandy soils and salty air. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Cyanea kahiliensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
